  "@context": "https://schema.org",

  "title": "Travel Insurance Manager",
  "description": "Changeroom was established in 2012 with a vision to produce quality human resource solutions. We plan to achieve this by partnering with our clients to provide highly specialized consulting services in the areas of human resources development and business management services. Our partnership approach affords us the opportunity of working with you to find the most efficient and appropriate solutions to meet your short, medium and long-term goals. In partnering with your organization, we make it our business to understand your business, embrace its values, aims and objectives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Travel Insurance Manager&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Tourism &amp; Hospital, Business, or a related field (Preferred)
	Previous experience in travel space
	Strong knowledge of travel insurance products and regulations
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Proficiency in relevant software and technology.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;bola@changeroom.ng&nbsp;and&nbsp;ginika@changeroom.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Travel Insurance Manager  Job at the Changeroom




        
    

        
        Changeroom was established in 2012 with a vision to produce quality human resource solutions. We plan to achieve this by partnering with our clients to provide highly specialized consulting services in the areas of human resources development and business management services. Our partnership approach affords us the opportunity of working with you to find the most efficient and appropriate solutions to meet your short, medium and long-term goals. In partnering with your organization, we make it our business to understand your business, embrace its values, aims and objectives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Travel Insurance Manager 
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Tourism & Hospital, Business, or a related field (Preferred)
	Previous experience in travel space
	Strong knowledge of travel insurance products and regulations
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Proficiency in relevant software and technology.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: bola@changeroom.ng and ginika@changeroom.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Real Estate Marketing Manager",
  "description": "Work Dey HR Services offers a wide range of HR Consulting Services to Organizations and Individuals. We match Suitable ans employable applicants to Genuine Vacancies in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Real Estate Marketing Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Our client is looking for a creative and results-driven Marketing Manager to lead brand strategy, drive property sales, and oversee all marketing initiatives for their real estate projects in Karasana.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute marketing campaigns across digital and traditional platforms
	Manage social media presence and content creation
	Coordinate property launches, open houses, and promotional events
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis
	Collaborate with sales and design teams to align messaging


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc./HND in Marketing, Communications, or related field
	Minimum of 4 years&rsquo; experience in marketing (real estate experience preferred)
	Strong digital marketing skills (SEO, SEM, social media ads)
	Excellent communication and leadership abilities
	Familiarity with CRM tools and analytics platform.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Portfolio to:&nbsp;career.wsl@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Marketing Manager &ndash; Karasana&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

Real Estate Marketing Manager Job at Work Dey HR Services




        
    

        
        Work Dey HR Services offers a wide range of HR Consulting Services to Organizations and Individuals. We match Suitable ans employable applicants to Genuine Vacancies in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Real Estate Marketing Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Our client is looking for a creative and results-driven Marketing Manager to lead brand strategy, drive property sales, and oversee all marketing initiatives for their real estate projects in Karasana.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and execute marketing campaigns across digital and traditional platforms
	Manage social media presence and content creation
	Coordinate property launches, open houses, and promotional events
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis
	Collaborate with sales and design teams to align messaging


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc./HND in Marketing, Communications, or related field
	Minimum of 4 years’ experience in marketing (real estate experience preferred)
	Strong digital marketing skills (SEO, SEM, social media ads)
	Excellent communication and leadership abilities
	Familiarity with CRM tools and analytics platform.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Portfolio to: career.wsl@gmail.com using “Marketing Manager – Karasana" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Work Dey HR Services -&nbsp;Our client, a dynamic real estate development firm is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Karasana,&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Our client, a dynamic real estate development firm in Karasana, Abuja, is seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accountant to manage financial records, ensure compliance, and support strategic financial planning.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and ledgers
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Manage budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow
	Ensure tax compliance and liaise with external auditors
	Monitor accounts payable/receivable and reconcile bank statements


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting or Finance
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role (real estate experience is a plus)
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage)
	Strong analytical and organizational skills
	ICAN/ACCA certification is an added advantage.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 / Month..

Method of Aplication
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to:&nbsp;career.wsl@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Accountant &ndash; Karasana&quot;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",

Accountant Job at Work Dey HR Services




        
    

        
        Work Dey HR Services - Our client, a dynamic real estate development firm is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Karasana, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Our client, a dynamic real estate development firm in Karasana, Abuja, is seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accountant to manage financial records, ensure compliance, and support strategic financial planning.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain accurate financial records and ledgers
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Manage budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow
	Ensure tax compliance and liaise with external auditors
	Monitor accounts payable/receivable and reconcile bank statements


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting or Finance
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role (real estate experience is a plus)
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage)
	Strong analytical and organizational skills
	ICAN/ACCA certification is an added advantage.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 / Month..

Method of Aplication
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: career.wsl@gmail.com using “Accountant – Karasana" as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cardiothoracic Nurse",
  "description": "The Reddington Multi-specialist Hospital built on nine floors provides fully comprehensive tertiary hospital solutions in most medical areas. Our journey as a healthcare provider began in March 2006 with the establishment of the Cardiac Centre, in Victoria Island, in association with the renowned Cromwell Hospital in London.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cardiothoracic Nurse

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Cardiothoracic Nurse provides specialized nursing care to patients undergoing surgical procedures of the heart, lungs, esophagus, and other organs within the chest cavity.


Patient Care:


	Deliver evidence-based nursing care to patients before, during, and after cardiothoracic surgeries (CABG, valve replacements, thoracotomies, lung resections, transplants, etc.).


Preoperative &amp; Postoperative Care:


	Educate patients and families on surgical procedures, risks, recovery expectations, and self-care.
	Prepare patients for surgery by ensuring informed consent, pre-op assessments, and adherence to safety protocols.
	Support recovery by monitoring surgical sites, preventing infection, and ensuring mobilization and rehabilitation.


Collaboration &amp; Teamwork:


	Work closely with surgeons, anesthesiologists, perfusionists, and respiratory therapists to ensure seamless care.
	Participate in multidisciplinary rounds and care planning meetings.
	Assist in intraoperative support (e.g., handling instruments, ensuring sterility, and providing surgeon assistance when needed).


Clinical Expertise &amp; Documentation:


	Maintain accurate and timely documentation of patient care, medications, and progress.
	Utilize advanced technology such as cardiac monitors, ventilators, and infusion pumps.
	Uphold infection prevention and control standards in all clinical activities.


Professional Development &amp; Compliance:


	Stay current with cardiothoracic nursing best practices, guidelines, and research.
	Adhere to hospital policies, regulatory requirements, and professional nursing standards.
	Mentor junior nurses, interns, and student nurses when required.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Education:&nbsp;Registered Nurse (RN) with a Bachelor of Nursing Science (B.NSc) or equivalent.
	Experience: 2&ndash;3 years of nursing experience; at least 1 year in cardiothoracic.
	Licensure:&nbsp;Current Nursing and Midwifery Council license (or equivalent in country of practice).
	Certifications:&nbsp;specialty certification in cardiothoracic/critical CCRN care nursing, BLS and ACLS required.


Skills:


	Strong clinical assessment and critical thinking abilities.
	Proficiency in ventilator and hemodynamic monitoring.
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
	Ability to handle high-stress situations and make quick, sound decisions.


Core Competencies:


	Patient-centered care
	Clinical expertise in cardiothoracic and critical care
	Adaptability and resilience under pressure
	Compassion and empathy in patient interactions
	Strong ethical and professional standards
	Conduct comprehensive patient assessments including vital signs, hemodynamic monitoring, and respiratory function.
	Administer medications, IV fluids, and blood products safely and accurately.
	Monitor patients in critical care and step-down units, recognizing and responding promptly to signs of deterioration.
	Provide wound care, chest tube management, ventilator support, and pain management.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-13",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-14",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "The Reddington Multi-specialist Hospital"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "187317"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Cardiothoracic Nurse Job at the Reddington Multi-specialist Hospital




        
    

        
        The Reddington Multi-specialist Hospital built on nine floors provides fully comprehensive tertiary hospital solutions in most medical areas. Our journey as a healthcare provider began in March 2006 with the establishment of the Cardiac Centre, in Victoria Island, in association with the renowned Cromwell Hospital in London.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cardiothoracic Nurse

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Cardiothoracic Nurse provides specialized nursing care to patients undergoing surgical procedures of the heart, lungs, esophagus, and other organs within the chest cavity.


Patient Care:


	Deliver evidence-based nursing care to patients before, during, and after cardiothoracic surgeries (CABG, valve replacements, thoracotomies, lung resections, transplants, etc.).


Preoperative & Postoperative Care:


	Educate patients and families on surgical procedures, risks, recovery expectations, and self-care.
	Prepare patients for surgery by ensuring informed consent, pre-op assessments, and adherence to safety protocols.
	Support recovery by monitoring surgical sites, preventing infection, and ensuring mobilization and rehabilitation.


Collaboration & Teamwork:


	Work closely with surgeons, anesthesiologists, perfusionists, and respiratory therapists to ensure seamless care.
	Participate in multidisciplinary rounds and care planning meetings.
	Assist in intraoperative support (e.g., handling instruments, ensuring sterility, and providing surgeon assistance when needed).


Clinical Expertise & Documentation:


	Maintain accurate and timely documentation of patient care, medications, and progress.
	Utilize advanced technology such as cardiac monitors, ventilators, and infusion pumps.
	Uphold infection prevention and control standards in all clinical activities.


Professional Development & Compliance:


	Stay current with cardiothoracic nursing best practices, guidelines, and research.
	Adhere to hospital policies, regulatory requirements, and professional nursing standards.
	Mentor junior nurses, interns, and student nurses when required.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Education: Registered Nurse (RN) with a Bachelor of Nursing Science (B.NSc) or equivalent.
	Experience: 2–3 years of nursing experience; at least 1 year in cardiothoracic.
	Licensure: Current Nursing and Midwifery Council license (or equivalent in country of practice).
	Certifications: specialty certification in cardiothoracic/critical CCRN care nursing, BLS and ACLS required.


Skills:


	Strong clinical assessment and critical thinking abilities.
	Proficiency in ventilator and hemodynamic monitoring.
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
	Ability to handle high-stress situations and make quick, sound decisions.


Core Competencies:


	Patient-centered care
	Clinical expertise in cardiothoracic and critical care
	Adaptability and resilience under pressure
	Compassion and empathy in patient interactions
	Strong ethical and professional standards
	Conduct comprehensive patient assessments including vital signs, hemodynamic monitoring, and respiratory function.
	Administer medications, IV fluids, and blood products safely and accurately.
	Monitor patients in critical care and step-down units, recognizing and responding promptly to signs of deterioration.
	Provide wound care, chest tube management, ventilator support, and pain management.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Business Development Officer Job at the Changeroom




        
    

        
        Change room was established in 2012 with a vision to produce quality human resource solutions. We plan to achieve this by partnering with our clients to provide highly specialized consulting services in the areas of human resources development and business management services. Our partnership approach affords us the opportunity of working with you to find the most efficient and appropriate solutions to meet your short, medium and long-term goals. In partnering with your organization, we make it our business to understand your business, embrace its values, aims and objectives.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	BSc Degree Marketing or any related discipline
	Minimum of 3 years of post qualification relevant experience in a similar job postion in the insurance space.
	Excellent communication, networking,and relationship building skills
	Ability to work independently
	Proven track record.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: bola@changeroom.ng and ginika@changeroom.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
